section: ir_Template.hpp main/IRRemote_Library/ir_Template.hpp Go to the documentation of this file.00001 /* 00002 Assuming the protocol we are adding is for the (imaginary) manufacturer: Shuzu 00003 00004 Our fantasy protocol is a standard protocol, so we can use this standard 00005 template without too much work. Some protocols are quite unique and will require 00006 considerably more work in this file! It is way beyond the scope of this text to 00007 explain how to reverse engineer "unusual" IR protocols. But, unless you own an 00008 oscilloscope, the starting point is probably to use the rawDump.ino sketch and 00009 try to spot the pattern! 00010 00011 Before you start, make sure the IR library is working OK: 00012 # Open up the Arduino IDE 00013 # Load up the rawDump.ino example sketch 00014 # Run it 00015 00016 Now we can start to add our new protocol... 00017 00018 1. Copy this file to : ir_Shuzu.cpp 00019 00020 2. Replace all occurrences of "Shuzu" with the name of your protocol. 00021 00022 3. Tweak the #defines to suit your protocol. 00023 00024 4. If you're lucky, tweaking the #defines will make the default send() function 00025 work. 00026 00027 5. Again, if you're lucky, tweaking the #defines will have made the default 00028 decode() function work. 00029 00030 You have written the code to support your new protocol! 00031 00032 Now you must do a few things to add it to the IRremote system: 00033 00034 1. Open IRremote.h and make the following change: 00035 REMEMBER to change occurrences of "SHUZU" with the name of your protocol 00036 At the top, in the section "Supported Protocols", add: 00037 #define DECODE_SHUZU 1 00038 #define SEND_SHUZU 1 00039 00040 2. Open IRProtocol.h and make the following change: 00041 In the section "An enum consisting of all supported formats", add: 00042 SHUZU, 00043 to the end of the list (notice there is a comma after the protocol name) 00044 00045 3. Open IRremoteInt.h and make the following changes: 00046 A. Further down in "Main class for receiving IR", add: 00047 //...................................................................... 00048 #if DECODE_SHUZU 00049 bool decodeShuzu () ; 00050 #endif 00051 00052 B. Further down in "Main class for sending IR", add: 00053 //...................................................................... 00054 #if SEND_SHUZU 00055 void sendShuzuStandard (uint16_t aAddress, uint8_t aCommand, uint_fast8_t aNumberOfRepeats) ; 00056 #endif 00057 00058 4. Save your changes and close the files 00059 00060 5. Now open IRReceive.hpp and make the following change: 00061 00062 A. In the function IRrecv::decode(), add: 00063 #ifdef DECODE_SHUZU 00064 IR_DEBUG_PRINTLN("Attempting Shuzu decode"); 00065 if (decodeShuzu()) return true ; 00066 #endif 00067 00068 B. In the function getProtocolString(), add 00069 case SHUZU: 00070 return ("Shuzu"); 00071 break; 00072 00073 C. Save your changes and close the file 00074 00075 6. Now open the Arduino IDE, load up the rawDump.ino sketch, and run it. 00076 Hopefully it will compile and upload. 00077 If it doesn't, you've done something wrong. Check your work. 00078 If you can't get it to work - seek help from somewhere. 00079 00080 If you get this far, I will assume you have successfully added your new protocol 00081 There is one last thing to do. 00082 00083 7. Delete this giant instructional comment. 00084 00085 8. Send a copy of your work to us so we can include it in the library and 00086 others may benefit from your hard work and maybe even write a song about how 00087 great you are for helping them! :) 00088 00089 Regards, 00090 BlueChip 00091 */ 00092 00093 /* 00094 * ir_Shuzu.cpp 00095 * 00096 * Contains functions for receiving and sending Shuzu IR Protocol ... 00097 * 00098 * Copyright (C) 2021 Shuzu Guru 00099 * shuzu.guru@gmail.com 00100 * 00101 * This file is part of Arduino-IRremote https://github.com/Arduino-IRremote/Arduino-IRremote. 00102 * 00103 ************************************************************************************ 00104 * MIT License 00105 * 00106 * Copyright (c) 2017-2021 Unknown Contributor :-) 00107 * 00108 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy 00109 * of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal 00110 * in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights 00111 * to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell 00112 * copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished 00113 * to do so, subject to the following conditions: 00114 * 00115 * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all 00116 * copies or substantial portions of the Software. 00117 * 00118 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, 00119 * INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A 00120 * PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT 00121 * HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF 00122 * CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE 00123 * OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE. 00124 * 00125 ************************************************************************************ 00126 */ 00127 #ifndef IR_SHUZU_HPP 00128 #define IR_SHUZU_HPP 00129 00130 #include <Arduino.h> 00131 00132 //#define DEBUG // Activate this for lots of lovely debug output from this decoder. 00133 #include "IRremoteInt.h" // evaluates the DEBUG for IR_DEBUG_PRINT 00134 00135 //#define SEND_SHUZU 1 // for testing 00136 //#define DECODE_SHUZU 1 // for testing 00137 //============================================================================== 00138 // 00139 // 00140 // S H U Z U 00141 // 00142 // 00143 //============================================================================== 00144 // see: https://www.... 00145 00146 // LSB first, 1 start bit + 16 bit address + 8 bit command + 1 stop bit. 00147 #define SHUZU_ADDRESS_BITS 16 // 16 bit address 00148 #define SHUZU_COMMAND_BITS 8 // Command 00149 00150 #define SHUZU_BITS (SHUZU_ADDRESS_BITS + SHUZU_COMMAND_BITS) // The number of bits in the protocol 00151 #define SHUZU_UNIT 560 00152 00153 #define SHUZU_HEADER_MARK (16 * SHUZU_UNIT) // The length of the Header:Mark 00154 #define SHUZU_HEADER_SPACE (8 * SHUZU_UNIT) // The length of the Header:Space 00155 00156 #define SHUZU_BIT_MARK SHUZU_UNIT // The length of a Bit:Mark 00157 #define SHUZU_ONE_SPACE (3 * SHUZU_UNIT) // The length of a Bit:Space for 1's 00158 #define SHUZU_ZERO_SPACE SHUZU_UNIT // The length of a Bit:Space for 0's 00159 00160 #define SHUZU_REPEAT_HEADER_SPACE (4 * SHUZU_UNIT) // 2250 00161 00162 #define SHUZU_REPEAT_SPACE 45000 00163 00164 #define SHUZU_OTHER 1234 // Other things you may need to define 00165 00166 //+============================================================================= 00167 // 00168 void IRsend::sendShuzu(uint16_t aAddress, uint8_t aCommand, uint_fast8_t aNumberOfRepeats) { 00169 // Set IR carrier frequency 00170 enableIROut(38); 00171 00172 uint_fast8_t tNumberOfCommands = aNumberOfRepeats + 1; 00173 while (tNumberOfCommands > 0) { 00174 00175 // Header 00176 mark(SHUZU_HEADER_MARK); 00177 space(SHUZU_HEADER_SPACE); 00178 00179 // Address (device and subdevice) 00180 sendPulseDistanceWidthData(SHUZU_BIT_MARK, SHUZU_ONE_SPACE, SHUZU_BIT_MARK, SHUZU_ZERO_SPACE, aAddress, 00181 SHUZU_ADDRESS_BITS, PROTOCOL_IS_LSB_FIRST); // false -> LSB first 00182 00183 // Command + stop bit 00184 sendPulseDistanceWidthData(SHUZU_BIT_MARK, SHUZU_ONE_SPACE, SHUZU_BIT_MARK, SHUZU_ZERO_SPACE, aCommand, 00185 SHUZU_COMMAND_BITS, PROTOCOL_IS_LSB_FIRST, SEND_STOP_BIT); // false, true -> LSB first, stop bit 00186 00187 tNumberOfCommands--; 00188 // skip last delay! 00189 if (tNumberOfCommands > 0) { 00190 // send repeated command in a fixed raster 00191 delay(SHUZU_REPEAT_SPACE / MICROS_IN_ONE_MILLI); 00192 } 00193 } 00194 } 00195 00196 //+============================================================================= 00197 // 00198 /* 00199 * First check for right data length 00200 * Next check start bit 00201 * Next try the decode 00202 * Last check stop bit 00203 */ 00204 bool IRrecv::decodeShuzu() { 00205 00206 // Check we have the right amount of data (28). The +4 is for initial gap, start bit mark and space + stop bit mark 00207 if (decodedIRData.rawDataPtr->rawlen != (2 * SHUZU_BITS) + 4) { 00208 // no debug output, since this check is mainly to determine the received protocol 00209 return false; 00210 } 00211 00212 // Check header "space" 00213 if (!matchMark(decodedIRData.rawDataPtr->rawbuf[1], SHUZU_HEADER_MARK) || !matchSpace(decodedIRData.rawDataPtr->rawbuf[2], SHUZU_HEADER_SPACE)) { 00214 IR_DEBUG_PRINT("Shuzu: "); 00215 IR_DEBUG_PRINTLN("Header mark or space length is wrong"); 00216 return false; 00217 } 00218 00219 // false -> LSB first 00220 if (!decodePulseDistanceData(SHUZU_BITS, 3, SHUZU_BIT_MARK, SHUZU_ONE_SPACE, SHUZU_ZERO_SPACE, PROTOCOL_IS_LSB_FIRST)) { 00221 IR_DEBUG_PRINT(F("Shuzu: ")); 00222 IR_DEBUG_PRINTLN(F("Decode failed")); 00223 return false; 00224 } 00225 00226 // Stop bit 00227 if (!matchMark(decodedIRData.rawDataPtr->rawbuf[3 + (2 * SHUZU_BITS)], SHUZU_BIT_MARK)) { 00228 IR_DEBUG_PRINT(F("Shuzu: ")); 00229 IR_DEBUG_PRINTLN(F("Stop bit mark length is wrong")); 00230 return false; 00231 } 00232 00233 // Success 00234 // decodedIRData.flags = IRDATA_FLAGS_IS_LSB_FIRST; // Not required, since this is the start value 00235 uint8_t tCommand = decodedIRData.decodedRawData >> SHUZU_ADDRESS_BITS; // upper 8 bits of LSB first value 00236 uint8_t tAddress = decodedIRData.decodedRawData & 0xFFFF; // lowest 16 bit of LSB first value 00237 00238 /* 00239 * Check for repeat 00240 */ 00241 if (decodedIRData.rawDataPtr->rawbuf[0] < ((SHUZU_REPEAT_SPACE + (SHUZU_REPEAT_SPACE / 4)) / MICROS_PER_TICK)) { 00242 decodedIRData.flags = IRDATA_FLAGS_IS_REPEAT | IRDATA_FLAGS_IS_LSB_FIRST; 00243 } 00244 decodedIRData.command = tCommand; 00245 decodedIRData.address = tAddress; 00246 decodedIRData.numberOfBits = SHUZU_BITS; 00247 decodedIRData.protocol = LG; // we have no SHUZU code 00248 00249 return true; 00250 } 00251 #endif // #ifndef IR_SHUZU_HPP 00252 #pragma once
